name: OneOver
description:
OneOver is an Asteroids-esque game that never ends. Made with GameMaker: Studio, it simplifies gaming to its bare essentials while adding a little kick/punch in the process.

Nothing fancy here, just plain old-school gaming.

Game Engine - GameMaker: Studio 1.4...
Sound FX - bfxr.net [evolution.voxeo.com]
Font - Visitor / dafont.com 
Graphics - Allan Grzicic
Coding - Allan Grzicic

---

v1.4.1.1 [Numbers 1.0] (Released August 31, 2017)
  • Letters changed to numbers (counting forwards and backwards from 0-40)

---

v1.4.1.1 [English Alphabet 1.1] (Released August 31, 2017)
  • Sprites and objects removed for letters (obj_eab, obj_eas, ...)
  • 4 font styles to choose from (backspace in-game or selectable via Settings)

---

v1.4.1.1 (Released August 26, 2017)

  • If mouse support enabled, Player 1 can brake via the right mouse button
  • Useless code removed from obj_deadplayer & obj_deadplayer2 (Step Event)

---

v1.4.1 [English Alphabet 1.0] (Released August 22, 2017)

  • Instead of adding asteroids after each level/wave, each wave consists of letters from the English Alphabet protected by the asteroids

---

v1.4.1 (Released August 9, 2017)

  • Added option to set dead zone of joystick axis via Player Settings (applies to both players)

---

v1.4 (Released August 8, 2017)

  • Added 2-player local co-op (Arcade Mode), F12/Start button on 2nd gamepad to enter game
  • Countdown at start of Arcade Mode down to 9 seconds

---

v1.3.1 (Released August 1, 2017)

  • Fix: Gamepad support (add/fix button for Arcade Mode)
  • Base/default resolution set at 1280x720 (still only two options at the moment)
  • One more color for asteroid and player selectable via Settings
  • 10-second countdown added to start of Arcade Mode

---

v1.3 (Released August 1, 2017)

  • Added gamepad support (testing stage)
  • Player can change Aspect Ratio via Settings (only two options at the moment), base resolution is still 1024x768

---

v1.2 (Released July 26, 2017)

  • Trail effect added to player (press 'T' key to switch it on/off)
  • Settings now saved in created .ini file during first playthrough (auto-saves when exiting game)
  • Options Menu modified, renamed to Settings
  • Fix: Pause Screen can only be enabled in-game
  • One more color for asteroid and player selectable via Settings (one more color to go)

---

v1.1 (Released July 23, 2017)

  • Added mouse support (in-game only)
  • Added extra colors for player, lasers, and asteroids (not yet available in options menu, but selectable via keyboard controls)

**WARNING** Crazy shooting mechanics with mouse support enabled (you'll see it when player has the same x and y coordinates as the mouse cursor with any amount of speed)

---

v1.0 (Released July 21, 2017)

---

More screenshots at the following link (v1.0 only):
https://agrizzlyblog.blogspot.ca/p/games.html
